page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT AROUND BURGHFIELD
page.content: Although agriculture and estate work were probably the original sources of employment in the Burghfield Common area,most of the development of the village has been due to post-war in- dustries.In particular,the Atomic Weapons Research Establishment (AWRE) at Aldermaston,and the Royal Ordnance Factory (ROF) in Burghfield,provide work for a large proportion of the community.Many local mothers work part-time at these establishments. Information Technology is another important industry for the residents of the area,which is situated in the so-called "Silicon Valley",a hi-tech region spreading from London to west of Reading.Many people commute to local towns or London to work with electronics- or computer-based firms. In a survey,over 50% of fathers of 10- 11yr.olds worked in Reading or London.
